channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk Buys $1 Billion in Tesla Stock as Board Defends His Pay
item.description: Tesla’s chief executive bought the stock after the company’s board proposed paying him nearly $1 trillion if he achieves certain performance goals.

item.title: Hair dryers from drones and makeup mirrors from movie animators: How L’Oréal makes open innovation work
item.description: L’Oréal demonstrates that Europe is becoming an increasingly strong hub for innovation, especially in the area of open innovation.

item.title: Bobby Hart, Who Helped Give the Monkees Their Music, Dies at 86
item.description: The hit songwriting duo he and Tommy Boyce formed in the 1960s was best known for the unexpectedly popular tunes of a made-for-TV band.

item.title: Investor who manages $900 million in assets says there’s one investing hack everyone should know: ‘I wish they would teach it more in high school’
item.description: Mohnish Pabrai is a major proponent of the Rule of 72.

item.title: Starvation and Bombs in Besieged Sudanese City As Residents Cry for Help
item.description: At least 260,000 civilians trapped in El Fasher face a dire choice: risk being starved or bombed if they stay, and raped or killed if they flee.

item.title: Rubio, in Israel, Says a Diplomatic Solution to Gaza War May Not be Possible
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel to discuss President Trump’s desire to see the war in Gaza end soo...

item.title: China says Nvidia violated antitrust laws as it ratchets up pressure ahead of U.S. trade talks
item.description: The chipmaker has increasingly found itself caught up in a tug of war between Washington and Beijing.

item.title: How Roy Jakobs is leveraging Dutch directness and the power of AI to transform Philips into a health-tech leader
item.description: Roy Jakobs, who joined Philips in 2010 and became CEO in 2022 amid a major crisis, has since played a key role in stabilizing the company.

item.title: Trump Redirects Millions to Historically Black Colleges, Charter Schools
item.description: The Trump administration is cutting money from programs that have supported minority students, including at other universities.

item.title: Trump suggests a TikTok deal is close as he reveals crunch talks with Xi Jinping while the Ellisons wait in the wings
item.description: Trump said on Truth Social that "a deal was reached on a 'certain' company that young people in our Country very much wanted to save. They will be ver...

item.title: India-Pakistan Tensions Hit New Pitch With Cricket Snub
item.description: The Indian players refused to shake hands with their Pakistani opponents at the first meeting of the sides since the two countries exchanged hostiliti...

item.title: Suspect in Madeleine McCann Disappearance Refuses Interview With UK Police
item.description: Christian Brückner, the main suspect in the 2007 case, rejected an interview request ahead of his release this week from a German prison for a separat...

item.title: Rubio, in Israel, Says a Diplomatic Solution to Gaza War May Not be Possible
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel to discuss President Trump’s desire to see the war in Gaza end soo...

item.title: U.S., China Conclude Talks With ‘Framework’ on TikTok Sale
item.description: Top economic officials met in Madrid for a second day, with deadlines looming on tariffs and a ban on TikTok in the United States if it is not sold by...

item.title: Starvation and Bombs in Besieged Sudanese City As Residents Cry for Help
item.description: At least 260,000 civilians trapped in El Fasher face a dire choice: risk being starved or bombed if they stay, and raped or killed if they flee.
